title: Bodily Harm Is Coming
dc:creator: Michael Vuolo
description: To a Klu Klux Klan member, a flaming cross is a "beautiful" symbol of "racial purity." To many Americans, it's the image of racist intimidation. But, what is it to the Supreme Court, and is it protected by the Constitution? In the emotionally-charged case, Virginia v. Black, the KKK learns the difference between intent and historical perception — with unexpected assistance from an African American ACLU lawyer. Plus: A Supreme Court Justice breaks his years-long silence. If you love Unprecedented, you can support the show and more great podcasts from WAMU by heading to wamu.org/donate.
